cluedo

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • cluedo.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a player in the game. Stores information such as the cards in the player's hand, the status of the player (eliminated from the game or not), and the token which represents the player on the board.
    Author:
    Aden Kenny and Simon Pope.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String username, Token personToken)
      Creates a player object, takes the player's username and a token representing the character they picked.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCard(Card card)
      Adds a card to this player's hand.
      boolean checkHand(Card other)
      Checks to see if the player's hand contains a card.
      java.util.Set<Card> getHand()
      Returns a set of the cards in the hand.
      java.lang.String getHandUserName()
      Returns a string used when displaying a player's hand.
      boolean getStatus()
      Returns true or false based on if the player is still participating in the game.
      Token getToken()
      Returns a player's token, so related to their position on the board itself.
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      Returns the player's username, used for addressing the players and for other player related methods.
      java.lang.String handString()
      Returns the hand of the player, with one card per line.
      void setStatus(boolean status)
      Sets the player's game status, either in or out of the game.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String username,
              Token personToken)
        Creates a player object, takes the player's username and a token representing the character they picked.
        Parameters:
        username - A string representing the player's username.
        personToken - A token representing the character the player selected.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        public boolean getStatus()
        Returns true or false based on if the player is still participating in the game. i.e. the player has not been eliminated from the game.
        Returns:
        A boolean based on if the player has lost or not.

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Returns the player's username, used for addressing the players and for other player related methods.
        Returns:
        A string representing this player's username.

      • getHandUserName

        public java.lang.String getHandUserName()
        Returns a string used when displaying a player's hand.
        Returns:
        The string of the players name.

      • getToken

        public Token getToken()
        Returns a player's token, so related to their position on the board itself.
        Returns:
        A token representing a player.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(boolean status)
        Sets the player's game status, either in or out of the game. Called when a player loses the game.
        Parameters:
        status - The boolean that is passed to the method.

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card card)
        Adds a card to this player's hand.
        Parameters:
        card - The card that is to be added.

      • checkHand

        public boolean checkHand(Card other)
        Checks to see if the player's hand contains a card.
        Parameters:
        other - The card to be checked if the player's hand contains.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing if the card is contained.

      • getHand

        public java.util.Set<Card> getHand()
        Returns a set of the cards in the hand. Used for graphically displaying a player's hand.
        Returns:
        A Set containing the cards in a player's hand.

      • handString

        public java.lang.String handString()
        Returns the hand of the player, with one card per line.
        Returns:
        A String representing the cards in a player's hand.
